result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard A. Bauer IV

records.addlTxt:
1:54 pm - Defendant Richard A. Bauer IV appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Jill L. Vendetti appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Petition for counsel filed. No attorney has been appointed yet for the defendant. Defendant wishes to proceed with today's hearing without an attorney.
Defendant requests bail modification. State denies motion. Court denies motion. State to draft order. 
After decision is made, defendant requests to have counsel going forward.
Sent for judicial review

10:37 AM Defendant Richard A. Bauer IV appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael C Turner appeared by video for Richard A. Bauer IV.  Attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is requesting that a new attorney be appointed and Attorney Turner be withdrawn as counsel of record. 
The defendant is instructed to apply at the Public Defender's Office. 
The Court finds that the defendant is feely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently requesting Attorney Turner to withdraw as counsel of record and will grant the motion and sign the appropriate orders.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 10:50 am.

Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline: 06-03-2022
Scheduling conference is set for 07-13-22 at 10:30 a.m. Br. 1
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL- 
Bail is currently set at $10,000.00 cash.  Attorney Turner requests significantly reduced cash bail or a recognizance bond. 
Attorney Barros objects to any modification.  The defendant already posted substantial cash bail in another case, was released and then picked up these charges.  
The Court comments and believes cash bail is necessary, but will modify the amount to $5,000.00 cash with the same conditions.
Attorney Turner to draft the necessary order.
Minutes.

Request and Response Regarding Open Records - emailed 03-11-2022

11:10 AM Defendant Richard A. Bauer IV appeared by video, Attorney Angelina R Scarpelli for State of Wisconsin appeared by video. 
The defendant qualifies for the Public Defender but they have not yet found an attorney to represent him. The court explains the defendant's options. 
The defendant wishes to apply for a court-appointed attorney, he is to fill out the paperwork. Defendant is willing to waive the time limit in which this preliminary hearing must be held. 
Court finds good cause to toll time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 03-09-22 at 11:00 a.m.   
Minutes.

ADDRESS INFO for Richard A. Bauer IV
Current: Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220   (Effective: 02-24-2022)
Prior: 1025 S 9Th St, Manitowoc, WI 54220
RE:  Felony bail jumping, on 02-21-22.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.
Order for Prints.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of felony bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 02-28-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $10,000.00 cash with the condition that he not possess or use any internet enabled devices.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Minutes.
